Articles.Content:
The Lean looks fantastic! PMA inspired?

Forgive me, but not sure what PMA is. =S

Thanks though.
You are just awesome. These parts look like real stock parts!
Be careful, udk_lethal_d0se- this mod looks so stock I think that soon, the devs will take notice and snatch you up, just like they did with Bac9.

Forgive me, but not sure what PMA is. =S

Thanks though.

No problem! The PMA is the Pressurized Mating Adapter used on the ISS to connect two different sized docking nodes. Do you think you could make the same thing as the Lean but going from 2.5m to 1.25m?

- Added new Part: UDK-CO4 "Lean"

It's a very funny-looking part!

Any plans for correct heatsinks on RTG module?

It's a very funny-looking part!

Any plans for correct heatsinks on RTG module?

Yes, I've been working on animated variants. I'm still playing with animation at the moment.

Really enjoying seeing these new parts, here's what I'm doing with them:

You got the contract for the central node of my new station, the four crossroads modules on the left are a single unit, with large CBMs for expansion modules and windows to watch the modules and perform important astronomical observations. The crossroads are perfect for the spine of the station. You can also see an RCS fuel tank, a couple of tenders and a pair of Titan launch vehicles.

Looking forward to the hydroponics.

Really enjoying seeing these new parts, here's what I'm doing with them:

You got the contract for the central node of my new station, the four crossroads modules on the left are a single unit, with large CBMs for expansion modules and windows to watch the modules and perform important astronomical observations. The crossroads are perfect for the spine of the station. You can also see an RCS fuel tank, a couple of tenders and a pair of Titan launch vehicles.

Looking forward to the hydroponics.

This is nice, glad to see my parts have been of use to you.

I really love the models and the lights for this. However, I'm really confused by all of the values you set-the weights are huge, and is there a reason for why the basic aisles and corridors require 30 energy a minute to run? You might say that the electricity required is actually more balanced than the stock parts, but the stock illuminators take 2.4 and 1.2 electricity per minute, and I'd like it to be closer to those values.

EDIT: I now understand that it is intended for use with the Nucleus. Also, I seem to have a problem with ladders and these new models. I can't climb to a stock capsule from the installed ladders on these models.

Edited June 13, 2013 by firerider521

The scifiest ship created with this pack so

Normally I create reasonably normal stations with this pack, but the new Lean modules made this Interplanetary Passenger Liner impossible not to make.

I've wanted stuff like this in KSP for a while. I'll wait until you get IVA views in to download it, but parts like this are why I really want to be able to move around inside modules with interiors, and be able to go from one module to the next while staying inside of it.

You should make a science module that (when you create the interior) has a who bunch of computer monitors in it.

I'm really enjoying this pack. I have a question/request though. Is it possible to make a 1.25m version of the generator "Nucleus"? I realise that this a "Large" Component pack, but the generator looks so cool that I would love to use it on smaller crafts also. Or would I be able to do that myself by adding "rescaleFactor = 0.625" to the config file? Sorry, I'm not too savvy with making changes to the config file. Anyway, great work mate, keep it up

Normally I create reasonably normal stations with this pack, but the new Lean modules made this Interplanetary Passenger Liner impossible not to make.

...and that's the coolest thing I've seen in KSP in ages...

Update:

- Added new part: UDK-HM1 "Abode"

Download has been updated in Original Post.
Oh sweet, another part for my collection!

Downloading this just for the 'lean'. Is it possible to create a bigger one, as in, longer, so that it can form a ring around something in the middle? Like...

(/ = lean, [] = hub cube, | - = straight parts)

..../.[].\

.../..|...\

.[]--[]--[]

...\..|.../

....\.[]./

Update:

- Added new part: UDK-OF1 "Hydro-Gro"

Download updated in Original Post.

What are your plans for Hydro-Gro?

Oh and love the 3 new parts since the last time I was here.

What are your plans for Hydro-Gro?

Oh and love the 3 new parts since the last time I was here.

The Hydro-Gro is the first of many Factory Components, it will effectively use resource(s) and generate a new one.

In this case, it will use ElectricCharge, Water & IntakeAir(Atmosphere) to generate Oxygen.

I have started writing a plugin to handle this, though I know that the Generator Module would be ample; I have some more advanced things planned for under-the-hood.

The Hydro-Gro is the first of many Factory Components, it will effectively use resource(s) and generate a new one.

In this case, it will use ElectricCharge, Water & IntakeAir(Atmosphere) to generate Oxygen.

I have started writing a plugin to handle this, though I know that the Generator Module would be ample; I have some more advanced things planned for under-the-hood.

Factory? I hope we can have an Orbital Ship Construction feature!
Squad, please take that guy and his stuff. We surely need a second station update (including life-support)!
Really loving the update speed. This pack is amazing! Keep going at it!

These parts look great! Downloading as we type Anyway youd be interested in producing some big girders, strut adapters, and more variety of cubic octagonal strut type parts? For station solar arrays, etc Thanks for the hard work man!

You just made building my refueling depot around Kerbin so much easier, though it did have an interesting side effect.

Its kind of dark because I forgot lights on the first two modules, but you can see the crew and power modules here...

and why it earned the name "Flashlight"

Thanks again and I can't wait for whatever else you add!

Please consider adding

stackSymmetry = 3

To the 'Crossroads' .cfg (UDKLD_Hub_1_Configuration) under the attachRules, as this will let you use 4-way symmetry to populate the Crossroads part
